The model is Horizon Credit Scorecard, a retail unsecured lending credit risk model used for origination decisions.
It was developed by the enterprise analytics team in partnership with risk management and is owned by the Chief Credit Officer organization.
The model uses logistic regression with a scorecard overlay, calibrated on five years of booked and performance data.
Primary data comes from internal loan servicing records, bureau tradeline attributes, and verified application data.
Development data covers 2019 through 2024, with monthly refresh checks and documented data quality controls.
Validation was performed by the independent model risk team in November 2025 with a satisfactory rating.
Back-testing and benchmark comparisons are performed quarterly against challenger models and realized default trends.
Monitoring reports include population stability, characteristic stability, and realized versus expected loss metrics.
Implementation is controlled through versioned releases, change management tickets, and role-based access controls.
Known limitations include sensitivity to macroeconomic shocks and reduced performance on thin-file applicants.
Compensating controls include policy overlays, override governance, and enhanced post-decision monitoring.
All methodology, assumptions, and governance evidence are documented in the vendor methodology and validation artifacts.
